00040 #ifndef _CameraManager_h
00041 #define _CameraManager_h
00042 
00043 #include "vector3.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 #include "quaternion.h"
00046 
00047 #include <vector>
00048 
00049 namespace Ogre
00050 {
00051     class Camera;
00052     class SceneNode;
00053     class SceneManager;
00054 }
00055 
00056 namespace phys
00057 {
00058     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00059     /// @class CameraManager
00060     /// @headerfile cameramanager.h
00061     /// @brief This is the manager class for all camera functions.
00062     /// @details This class contains all the functionality of the use and manipulation of the camera. @n
00063     /// All functions that manipulate the camera will default to the default camera, so if you only use
00064     /// one camera you should never have to name the camera you want to use.
00065     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00066     class CameraManager {
00067         private:
00068             friend class World;
00069             Ogre::SceneManager* SceneManager;
00070             Ogre::Camera* DefaultCamera;
00071             std::vector< Ogre::Camera* > Cameras;
00072             std::vector< Ogre::SceneNode* > Nodes;
00073             unsigned short ONodes;
00074             unsigned short SNodes;
00075             Ogre::Camera* FindCamera(String Name);
00076             Ogre::SceneNode* FindNode(String Name);
00077         public:
00078             /// @brief Class Constructor.
00079             /// @details This is the class constructor.  This is automatcally called in the World.CreateRenderWindow()
00080             /// function and should never need to be called manually.
00081             /// @param SManager A pointer to the Scenemanager where you will be creating/manipulating all the cameras.
00082             CameraManager(Ogre::SceneManager* SManager);
00083             /// @brief Class Destructor.
00084             /// @details The calss Destuctor
00085             virtual ~CameraManager();
00086             /// @brief Creates a camera.
00087             /// @details This function will create a camera in the scene and return the string that is name of the
00088             /// camera created.  The first camera created will always be the Default camera, and is also created just
00089             /// after this class is constructed in the World.CreateRenderWindow() function.
00090             String CreateCamera();
00091             /// @brief Creates a node that will orbit around a point.
00092             /// @details This will create 2 nodes in the scene, the first being the point in the world you want to orbit
00093             /// the second node around.  The second being the node that does the orbiting.  You can then attach a camera
00094             /// to the orbiting node for some interesting visuals of your scene.
00095             /// @param Target The location of the first node which you will be orbiting around.
00096             /// @param RelativeLoc The location of the node that will be in orbit relative to the first node.  Assume the
00097             /// first node is at Origin (0,0,0).
00098             String CreateOrbitingNode(Vector3 Target, Vector3 RelativeLoc);
00099             /// @brief Creates a stationary node that will look at a location.
00100             /// @details This will create a node that doesn't move, and will look at one location that you specify.  This
00101             /// node can then have cameras attached to it.
00102             /// @param LookAt The location you want the node to look at.  Automatically handles orientation.
00103             /// @param Location The location of the node itself.
00104             String CreateStandNode(Vector3 LookAt, Vector3 Location);
00105             /// @brief Deletes all nodes created by this manager.
00106             /// @details This will clear the container of nodes.  Including Orbiting nodes, Center nodes, and Stand nodes.
00107             void ClearNodes();
00108             /// @brief Deletes all cameras except for the first camera.
00109             /// @details This will clear the container of cameras.  The default camera is not stored in this container
00110             /// however, so it is spared from this wipe.
00111             void ClearCameras();
00112             /// @brief Sets the location of a camera.
00113             /// @details Sets the location of the specified camera.
00114             /// @param Location The new location for the camera.
00115             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00116             void SetLocation(Vector3 Location, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00117             /// @brief Sets the Direction for the camera.
00118             /// @details Sets which axis the camera will look down for rendering.
00119             /// @param Direction The vector3 representing the axis to be used.
00120             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00121             void SetDirection(Vector3 Direction, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00122             /// @brief Sets the orientation of the camera.
00123             /// @details This function will set the orientation of the specified camera via a quaternion.
00124             /// @param Orientation The quaternion representing the new orientation.
00125             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00126             void SetOrientation(Quaternion Orientation, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00127             /// @brief Sets the short range clip distance.
00128             /// @details Sets the distance at which objects are considered too close to render.
00129             /// @param NearDist A Real representing the distance.  Note:  This number directly corolates to the dimentions
00130             /// you provide in the constructor for the physgame.  You should understand your games scale before setting
00131             /// this number.
00132             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00133             void SetNearClipDistance(Real NearDist, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00134             /// @brief Sets the long range clip distance.
00135             /// @details Sets the distance at which objects are considered too far to render.
00136             /// @param FarDist A Real representing the distance.  Note:  This number directly corolates to the dimentions
00137             /// you provide in the constructor for the physgame.  You should understand your games scale before setting
00138             /// this number.
00139             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00140             void SetFarClipDistance(Real FarDist, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00141             /// @brief Sets the aspect ration of the cameras veiw.
00142             /// @details This function will set the aspect ration between the width and height of the cameras viewing area.
00143             /// @param Ratio A Real that represents the aspect ratio, where Ratio = width / height.
00144             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00145             void SetAspectRatio(Real Ratio, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00146             /// @brief Sets the direction the camera faces.
00147             /// @details Sets the direction the camera faces.  Will also take orientation into account.
00148             /// @param TargetLoc The location in the game world to look at.
00149             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00150             void LookAt(Vector3 TargetLoc, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00151             /// @brief Sets whether to lock rotation around the Y axis.
00152             /// @details This function will lock rotations around the Y axis (or another axis if you specify).  This
00153             /// function is automatically called on by the camera constructor.
00154             /// @param UseFixed Enable or disable the locking of the axis.
00155             /// @param Axis The axis to lock, defaults to the Y axis.
00156             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00157             void SetFixedYawAxis(bool UseFixed, Vector3 Axis, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00158             /// @brief Sets whether to lock rotation around the Y axis.
00159             /// @details This function will lock rotations around the Y axis.  This function is automatically called
00160             /// on by the camera constructor.
00161             /// @param UseFixed Enable or disable the locking of the axis.
00162             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00163             void SetFixedYawAxis(bool UseFixed, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00164             /// @brief Enables or disables auto tracking for the camera.
00165             /// @details This function can enable auto tracking of a given node you have created.
00166             /// @param Enabled Bool value to enable or disable auto tracking for this camera.
00167             /// @param Target Name of the node to be tracked.
00168             /// @param Offset The offset of where the camera is to look from the target.  I.E. Always 5 units ahead, etc..
00169             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00170             void SetAutoTracking(bool Enabled, String Target, Vector3 Offset, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00171             /// @brief Enables or disables auto tracking for the camera.
00172             /// @details This function can enable auto tracking of a given node you have created.
00173             /// @param Enabled Bool value to enable or disable auto tracking for this camera.
00174             /// @param Target Name of the node to be tracked.
00175             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00176             void SetAutoTracking(bool Enabled, String Target, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00177             /// @brief Gets the node attached to a camera.
00178             /// @details This will return a string that is the name of the node the specified camera is attached to if any.
00179             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00180             String GetNodeAttachedToCamera(String Name="DefaultCamera");
00181             /// @brief Gets the location of a node.
00182             /// @details Gets the location of the node specified.
00183             /// @param Name Name of the node to get the location of.
00184             Vector3 GetNodeLocation(String Name);
00185             /// @brief Gets the location of a camera.
00186             /// @details Gets the location of the camera specified.
00187             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00188             Vector3 GetCameraLocation(String Name="DefaultCamera");
00189             /// @brief Will zoom in or out the camera.
00190             /// @details This function will zoom in the camera by the amount specified.
00191             /// @param Zoom A Real of how much to zoom in by.  Note:  This number directly corolates to the dimentions
00192             /// you provide in the constructor for the physgame.  You should understand your games scale before setting
00193             /// this number.
00194             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00195             void ZoomCamera(Real Zoom, String Name="DefaultCamera");
00196             /// @brief Resets the zoom level back to the default.
00197             /// @details This function will return the zoom level back to normal.
00198             /// @param Name The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00199             void ResetZoom(String Name="DefaultCamera");
00200             /// @brief Attaches a camera to a node.
00201             /// @details Attaches the specified camera to the specified node.
00202             /// @param NodeName The name of the node to attach the camera to.
00203             /// @param CamName The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00204             void AttachCameraToNode(String NodeName, String CamName="DefaultCamera");
00205             /// @brief Detaches a camera from a node.
00206             /// @details Detaches the specified camera from the specified node.
00207             /// @param NodeName The name of the node to detach the camera from.
00208             /// @param CamName The name of the camera to be manipulated.  Defaults to the Default camera.
00209             void DetachCameraFromNode(String NodeName, String CamName="DefaultCamera");
00210             /// @brief Increments the orbit by the amount specified.
00211             /// @details Increments the orbit of the specified node by the amount specified.
00212             /// @param Radian The amount you wish to increment the orbit in Radians.
00213             /// @param Name The name of the orbiting node you wish to increment the orbit for.
00214             void IncrementYOrbit(Real Radian, String Name);
00215     };
00216 }//phys
00217 #endif
